title: Plant power: Transplanted plant parts use photosynthesis to slow osteoarthritis progression
author: Helen Floersh
description: We humans may rule the jungle, but the plants around us do have us beat on one thing: photosynthesis, or the ability to convert sunlight into energy. | Scientists have found a way to use natural plant organelles to induce photosynthesis in mammalian cells. The energy produced was enough to stall osteoarthritis progression in mice, opening the door to new treatments for the condition along with other diseases involving cell metabolism.
